Can we trust AI Pentesters in live environments?
AI is already changing how we approach security testing, from automated recon to context-aware exploitation. But with great power comes great… unpredictability.
Today, I’m releasing a blog post that outlines a structured certification framework for AI-based penetration testing agents.
Why?
🥷 To give security leaders and practitioners confidence in deploying AI tools
🥷 To benchmark agent capabilities against human-level standards (like OSCP/OSEP)
🥷 And most importantly ... to ensure safe, scoped, and accountable use of AI in live environments
I’ve developed a detailed scoring matrix (aligned with CREST, PTES, OffSec principles) and introduced certification tiers ranging from Experimental to Certified AI Pentester.
This isn’t about replacing humans ... it’s about building trust in autonomy.
Would love to hear your thoughts. Are we ready for AI red teamers? Or still early days?
